APA2006121-d-12-27-06-APA.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
APA2006121-d-12-27-06-APA.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
APA2006121-d-12-27-06-APA.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 10:30 PM LOCOMOTIVE 83 A NON-RAILROAD LOCOMOTIVE AND A TWO MAN NON-RAILROAD SWITCHING CREW WAS SWITCHING INBOUND LOADS FROM THE APA`S #1 INTERCHANGE TRACK TO A PRIVATE INDUSTRY WHEN THE SWITCHMAN FAILED TO SWITCH THE FIFTEEN LOADED BOX CARS FROM #1 INTERCHANGE TRACK TO THE MAIN LINETRACK.  THE SWITCHMAN THEN INSTRUCTED THE ENGINE MAN TO MAKE A SHOVING MOVEMENT APPROXIMATELY ONE HALF OF A MILE TO THE WEST.  THE SWITCHMAN THEN ABANDONED THE POINT AND DROVE TO THE WEST END OF THEINTERCHANGE TRACK WHERE HE WAS GOING TO SWITCH THE CARS ONTO A INDUSTRY HOLDING TRACK.  HOWEVER, THEENGINEMAN TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY ONE QUARTER OF A MILE AND SIDE-SWIPED TWO LOADED BOX CARS THAT WERE OVER THE SWITCH ON THE WEST END OF THE APA`S #1 AND #2 INTERCHANGE TRACK WITH THE FIFTEENTH CAR FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE CAUSING CONSIDERABLE DAMAGE TO THREE BOX CARS (BNSF 760002, BNSF 760242, GNWR 1415).  THE ESTIMATED COST OF THE DAMAGE TO THREE BOX CARS IS $35,000.  NO OTHER DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT ORSTRUCTURE WAS INCURRED AND NO INJURIES OCCURED DURING THIS ACCIDENT.  THE SWITCHMAN FAILED TO FOLLOWPROPER RADIO PROCEDURES AND FAILED TO FOLLOW PROPER PROCEDURES UNDER YARD LIMITS (RESTRICTED SPEED).  ALSO, THE SWITCHMAN AND THE ENGINEMAN WERE AWARE OF THE EQUIPMENT PARKED OVER THE TURNOUT ON THEWEST END OF THE #1 AND #2 INTERCHANGE TRACKS.

199444-d-12-11-06-DH.Narrative: TRAIN 254-08 PULLED IN TRACK 29 IN SK YARD AT WEST YARD. MADE A CUT WITH THE REAR 10 CARS AND ADVANCED MARKER. THEN TRAIN PULLED EAST ON TRACK 29 OVER LEAD AT BAILEY AVE TO TRACK 7 NORTH YARD. TRAIN PROCEEDED TO EAST END OF 7, ENGINEER APPLIED BRAKES ON TRAIN AND TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CONDUCTORDROVE TO EAST END OF SEVEN TO TIE TRAIN DOWN, THEN PROCEEDED TO WEST END OF TRAIN AND FOUND 3 CARSDERAILED. WHEN TRAIN DERAILED, KNOCKED OVER WEST TOWER LIGHT (APPROX 150 TALL LIGHT) AND CRASHED ONTO BAILEY ROAD. LIGHT POLE DID NOT HIT ANYTHING WHEN THE POLE FELL. A VEHICLE DID HIT POLE THAT WAS ON ROADWAY AND OCCUPANT WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL.  INJURIES WERE REPORTED AS MINOR.  DELAYED REPORTING TO FRA DUE TO WAITING FOR MECHANICAL COSTS TO CONFIRM INCIDENT MET THE THRESHOLD CRITERIA.  REC'D MECHANICAL COSTS: $$5,269.00, NS ESTIMATED TRACK COSTS $2,000.00, TOWER DAMAGE $1,000.00, VEHICLE DAMAGE (TOTALED) $13,191.00.00.

540766-d-12-05-06-IC.Narrative: R91171-04 WAS PULLING 55 LOADS AND 37 EMPTIES AT 5 MPH ON THE PRESIDENT'S ISLAND INDUSTRY LEAD WHENTHE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD BEEN COUNTING THE ENGINEER DOWN AND PROCEEDED TO CHECK THE TRAIN AFTER IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND FOUND EIGHT CARS DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION FOUND THATTHE CARS DERAILED DUE TO THE INTERACTION OF LATERAL/VERTICAL FORCES.  HAZARDOUS CARS, NATX 23326 AND PLCX 22127, DERAILED ON THEIR SIDES AND WERE LEAKING FROM THE VALVE WITHIN THE TOP DOME OF EACH TANK CAR.  BOTH CARS CONTAINED SODIUM BISULPHITE AND LEAKED APPROXIMATELY 50 GALLONS OF PRODUCT.  CN RISK MANAGEMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND SUPERVISORS RESPONDED, AS WELL AS LOCAL AUTHORITIES AND SHELBY COUNTY EMERGENCY SERVICES.  A SMALL AREA OF 150 FEET INCLUDING 12 FACTORY WORKERS WERE TEMPORARILY EVACUATED.
